ai.summary: A demanding coastal heritage hike around Brixham, covering 19.1 km with steep climbs and uneven surfaces, offering sea views, harbours, and historic sites.
ai.terrain_summary: Rugged coastal paths, uneven stony tracks, steps, and cliffside sections, with some road crossings. Expect long ascents, exposed winds, and variable footing; sturdy boots and careful footing are essential.
ai.safety_notes: Check tide timings for any shoreline segments; weather can change rapidly on the coast—bring waterproofs and warm layers. Stay well back from cliff edges, carry a map or GPS, and hike with a partner or inform someone of your route and expected finish time. Carry enough water and a basic first aid kit; know your limits and turn back if conditions deteriorate.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Water bottle or hydration system (2–3 L)
Map and compass or GPS device
Gloves and hat for cooler months
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly April to October) when daylight is longer and trails are drier; winter hikes may be colder and more exposed to wind and wet conditions.

seo.title: Brixham Heritage Trail – 19.1 km Coastal Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Plan your adventure on the Brixham Heritage Trail, a hard 19.1 km coastal hike in the UK. Learn about the route, terrain, safety tips, and gear.
